text: Hello, is there a way to have two ore more domains connected to one site, I like to have a multilingual site that not uses the sub folder /en/ method but an own domain name: <http://site.nl|site.nl> in Dutch and <http://site.com|site.com> in English etc.
<@U019UH2V62K> If you have Enterprise, you can use Brand domains
It should come with 1 brand domain, and if you need more, you can buy additional bran domains
> Available as an add-on to Marketing Hub Enterprise, or CMS Hub Enterprise

Thank you, this enterprise is not really an option. this client wants to move from WordPress to HS, but has for each language a separate tld. this company is not a enterprise company money wise. so Then what option do we have? maybe the sub-folder option?.

Hello everyone, I'm brand new to everything HubSpot and I'm not even sure if
this is the proper channel to ask this but I'm wondering how I can
modify the "template" of a blog post and by template I don't mean the
view that renders a post but more the model of a post, the data.
For
my project we have a Blog property that should contain the estimate in
read time for said blog post, now that information should be displayed
in the listing template as well as in the blog detail view. HubSpot does
 the same in their own blog (see <http://blog.HubSpot.com|blog.HubSpot.com>)
 and I was wondering how I can replicate that since it can't be part of a
 module right? Since I also need to access that data in the listing
template. Any help or even pointers to guides/turorials are welcome,
thank you!

You can use LESS in your local development and deploy your changes using CLI. In the deployment process, you can add a compiling/building process for LESS files and that should work :slightly_smiling_face:
There are a few different ways people are doing it. I've if you look at our vue boilerplate you can see a SCSS implementation example.

Hey <@UDHT6N5SM> A little late ot the party but you can see in the network console if this is working. You’ll see a tracking pixel fire off, very similar to the page view one that’s there by default but with a different type value.  That will let you know in real time if your event is at least firing.  Note that it’s a pixel load specifically to avoid the CORS issue. The HTTP Events API is mostly for firing events from the back end or from a mobile app
Anyone? :thinking_face:
<@UFBNA9K9A> Thanks, it's definitely firing! This actually might have revealed a bug because it looks to be firing 3-4 times in a row which can't be right...
twice actually
(bug on my end)
Are you seeing it in your HubSpot account now?  (perhaps more than you would like? :slightly_smiling_face:)
not way more than I would expect but it does look like it triggered twice at the same time

Hey <@U01C4S7NPDX>,

You can accomplish this by adding a hubl tag to the `{% if !is_listing_view %}` part of your template, like `{% text "read_time" value="9 Minutes" label="Read Time" export_to_template_context=True %}`
Hey Dimitri, what plan does the customer have? If you are on CMS Pro, you should be able to add the other TLD’s as secondary domains with the above mentioned. Example:
Then, when you want to get the value, reference `{{ post.widgets.read_time.body.value }}` (use the Developer Info to find the exact schema)
Marketing Hub Pro also allows this (granted you wouldnt have the “Website” ability with that)
<@U24GZQ3GF> it's just `{{name}}` within the module HTML

I would recommend <@U38EZFVFE>’s suggestion of:
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CDSFETF5X/p1602355484050400>

Chances are there is a plugin blocking this from popping up.
Thank you! I will try this.
Indeed we did make an improvement! Apologies for not notifying you directly when it was shipped.

Hi, All.  We are running into some issues with our externally hosted forms (linked from social media/containing utms) being submitted via API and the _new contact_ being created not being attributed to the _Paid Social_ channel in HubSpot analytics.  The cookie is definitely being passed with the form submission as we are not longer seeing that being indicated when viewing the form submission details in HubSpot.  Sessions are created under _Paid Social_ channel, but the contact created is not being attributed.

Any direction here, even to a more appropriate channel, would be greatly appreciated.
